message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of learning robust text representations that can generalize well to both similar and dissimilar instances seen in training. This is a common problem in natural language processing, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes a novel method that involves joint learning of a structured neural model with domain-specific and domain-general components, coupled with adversarial training for domain. This method involves machine learning techniques such as deep learning and adversarial training, which are commonly used in sub-categories such as machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and information retrieval (cs.IR). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, and cs.IR, in that order.
